comments.body:
```suggestion
    /**
     * The default set of options to show before the user starts searching. When
     * set to `true`, the results for loadOptions('') will be automatically loaded.
     *
     * @default false
     */
    defaultOptions?: GroupedOptionsType<OptionType> | OptionsType<OptionType> | boolean;
```

Before you groan, hear me out! With formatting comments _exactly_ like [this](https://jsdoc.app/), VS Code, Sublime, and JetBrains have an automatic or (often-installed) in-editor integration. Additionally, tools like react-docgen (used by Storybook) can automatically parse the comments and turn them into documentation with their Docs mode.

I'd _love_ if you made this change while here... or at least let's add it to the road map of the TS conversion ticket. I don't making that change. It's so trivial too... Would be a good one to tweet out maybe?!
I'll do it in a follow-up PR. ;)

It seems our prettier configs differ ðŸ˜‚ 

Would you mind adding a prettier config to the root of this package's typedefs so we dont see format-related diffs in reviews going forward?
I usually prefer 2 spaces, the 4 spaces is DT specific (see second bullet point [here](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#common-mistakes)).
Strange ðŸ¤” - perhaps the repo is so large that the root-level prettier config didnt properly pick up in my editor?
Isn't there a combination of props where this method is required?

From a practical sense, yes, but from a type-safety sense it's not required (i.e., everything will work as designed even if no props are provided to this component, there will just never be any options in the Select drop-down).
